世.definition: life; age; generation; era; world; lifetime; epoch; descendant; noble

世上無難事，只怕有心人.pinyin: shì shàng wú nán shì ， zhǐ pà yǒu xīn rén
世上無難事，只怕有心人.definition: see 天下無難事，只怕有心人|天下无难事，只怕有心人[tian1 xia4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2]

世事.definition: affairs of life; things of the world

世人.definition: people (in general); people around the world; everyone

世代.definition: for many generations; generation; era; age

世代相傳.definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down

世伯.definition: uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father); old friend

世博.definition: abbr. for 世界博覽會|世界博览会[Shi4 jie4 Bo2 lan3 hui4], World Expo

世博會.definition: World Expo (abbr. for 世界博覽會|世界博览会[Shi4 jie4 Bo2 lan3 hui4])

世子.definition: crown prince; heir of a noble house

世宗.definition: Sejong the Great or Sejong Daewang (1397-1450), reigned 1418-1450 as fourth king of Joseon or Chosun dynasty, in whose reign the hangeul alphabet was invented

世宗大王.definition: Sejong the Great or Sejong Daewang (1397-1450), reigned 1418-1450 as fourth king of Joseon or Chosun dynasty, in whose reign the hangeul alphabet was invented

世家.definition: family influential for generations; aristocratic family

世尊.definition: World Honored One; Revered One of the World (Buddha)

世局.definition: the world situation; the state of the world

世情.definition: worldly affairs; the ways of the world

世態.definition: the ways of the world; social behavior

世界人權宣言.pinyin: shì jiè rén quán xuān yán

世界博覽會.definition: World Expo; abbr. to 世博[Shi4 bo2]

世界各地.definition: all over the world; everywhere; in all parts of the world

世界報.definition: the name of various newspapers, notably Le Monde (France), El Mundo (Spain) and Die Welt (Germany)

世界小姐選美.pinyin: shì jiè xiǎo jiě xuǎn měi

世界屋脊.definition: the roof of the world (usually refers to Tibet or Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau 青藏高原[Qing1 Zang4 gao1 yuan2])
